creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
medium: Tanba ware, stoneware with natural ash glaze
text: Although this bottle for serving sake (Japanese rice liquor) was made at a time when Tanba potters were sometimes using artificial glazes to decorate their work, it features a more traditional Tanba style. The burst of natural ash glaze that drips from the mouth and shoulder makes a dramatic contrast to the reddish brown Tanba clay.
title: Sake Bottle
